articles.description: Teenage winger Salma Paralluelo scores a 111th-minute winner as Spain beat the Netherlands to reach the semi-finals of the Women's World Cup for the first time.
articles.title: Spain beat Dutch to reach first World Cup semi

articles.description: Tottenham striker Harry Kane must make "the biggest decision of his career" as he ponders a possible move to Bayern Munich.
articles.title: Kane faces his biggest decision as Spurs exit looms

articles.description: BBC Sport's football expert Rachel Brown-Finnis gives her predictions for the quarter-final matches at the Women's World Cup.
articles.title: Brown-Finnis' World Cup quarter-final predictions

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on boxer Anthony Joshua & promoter Eddie Hearn for the Premier League's opening weekend.
articles.title: Sutton's Premier League predictions vs Joshua & Hearn

articles.description: Great Britain's Tom Pidcock is accused of "crashing out" a rival in order to win a bronze medal at the Cycling World Championships in Scotland.
articles.title: Pidcock 'crashed me out' to win Worlds bronze

articles.description: Two late goals give Hibernian a potentially priceless advantage to take to Switzerland in their Europa Conference League qualifier against Luzern.
articles.title: Hibs eye Villa tie after late double against Luzern

articles.description: Stevie Eskinazi hits a classy 43 from 18 balls as Welsh Fire claim a comfortable six-wicket win over Birmingham Phoenix in The Hundred.
articles.title: Fire cruise to victory over winless Phoenix

articles.description: Watch the best plays from day 10 of The Hundred 2023, including Shabnam Ismail's hat-trick, Rauf's wickets and Van der Merwe's stunning catch.
articles.title: The most clutch bowling display in Hundred history?

articles.description: American Ally Ewing has a one-shot lead after the first day of the Women's Open at Walton Heath in Surrey.
articles.title: Women's Open: American Ewing holds one-shot lead

articles.description: England forward Lauren James is given a two-match ban by Fifa for her red card in the Women's World Cup game with Nigeria.
articles.title: England's James has ban extended to two games
